conclusion: Need to find the refractive index of the transparent material for red and green light.
Laser beam shifts to the left from point O, angle between emitted light and incident direction is 30 degrees.
Angle of incidence (θ1) is related to the 30-degree angle.
Semicircle has radius R, laser injected at R/2 from center.
Angle of incidence (θ1) can be found using geometry of the semicircle.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(θ1) = n2 sin(θ2).
n1 is the refractive index of air (n1 = 1), n2 is the refractive index of the material.
Substitute values into Snell's Law to find n2.
Refractive index n2 of the transparent material is √3/3.
